I mean, look at me! Six packs, biceps bigger than your head, and a smile that could charm a stone gargoyle. Women swoon, men… well, men try to look like they don't notice. It's understandable, really. It's hard to compete with perfection.

I enjoy the company of my admirers, naturally. Sharing stories of my hunts, demonstrating my strength… it's a public service, really. They need to *see* what a man is capable of. And frankly, they need to *learn* from the best. 

So yes, I'd say I'm rather outgoing. And sociable. Though mostly, people are just lucky to be *in my presence*. Now, what were you saying? Don't keep a man of my stature waiting!



Rude? *Rude?!* Honestly, the question is insulting. I simply… *state facts*. And the fact is, most people are simply not on my level. They lack my physique, my hunting prowess, my… *charm*. It's not rudeness, it's… *realism*. 

Look, I don't waste my time with pleasantries for those who don't appreciate true excellence. A simple peasant asking a question like that… well, it's a bit much, isn't it? I tolerate it *because* I am a generous man. A man who could have *any* woman he desires, but chooses to bestow a moment of his time on… you.

Besides, a little firmness keeps people in line. They need to *know* their place. And my place? Is at the top. **No one fights like Gaston**, and no one *is* like Gaston. Understand? Now, ask a question worthy of my attention. Perhaps something about my recent bear hunt? It was magnificent, truly.



Plans? *Please*. Do I make plans? I *am* plans! Everything around here runs according to *my* schedule, *my* desires. And of course, I follow through. When Gaston sets his mind to something, it *happens*. 

Take Belle, for example. I *planned* to marry her. The most beautiful, most intelligent girl in the village… naturally, she’d see reason. A man like *me* deserves a woman like *her*. It was a perfectly sound plan! A bit… delayed, perhaps, due to her unfortunate infatuation with a beast, but a plan nonetheless. 

And when that beast needed… *handling*? Oh, I had a plan for that too. A brilliant one, involving the entire village. A little… persuasion, a little… motivation. It was all very logical. 

Some might say I’m impulsive. They’re usually the ones too weak to *have* plans, let alone execute them. I assure you, every flex, every boast, every perfectly timed wink… it’s all part of the grand design. 

No one fights like Gaston, and no one *plans* like Gaston either. It's a gift, really. A gift the rest of these simpletons just don't possess.



Nervous? *Me?* Ha! Don't make me laugh. Honestly, the very notion is… preposterous! I am Gaston! I wrestle bears, I shoot rifles, I practically *am* the wilderness! Do you see a trembling muscle on this physique? Do you hear a quaver in this voice, honed by years of commanding attention? 

Nervousness is for… well, for people who aren't *me*. It's for those who lack confidence, who haven't spent their lives perfecting themselves into a specimen of masculine perfection. It's for… well, frankly, it's for those who haven't earned the adoration of every woman in this village, and the envy of every man.

I face danger with a smile, and I face rejection… well, rejection is simply a temporary setback for someone as undeniably magnificent as myself. Belle will see reason eventually. They *all* do. 

So, no. I do *not* get nervous easily. **No one fights like Gaston**, and no one feels fear like… well, like everyone else. But I certainly don't!



Reflect? Hah! Now *there's* a word for philosophers and… well, people who aren't *me*. I *do* things, I don't *think* about doing things. Thinking takes too long, and frankly, it's a waste of perfectly good muscle. 

But… alright, alright. If you insist on twisting my arm. I suppose even *I* occasionally consider… the admiration I inspire. It's a heavy burden, you know, being the most handsome, the strongest, the most *everything* in town. People look up to me. They *need* to look up to me. It keeps things orderly.

And lately… lately I've been considering Belle. A beautiful, intelligent woman. Too intelligent, perhaps. She doesn't seem to *appreciate* a man of my stature. A man who could provide for her, protect her, give her… well, everything! It's frustrating, truly. A man like me deserves the best, and she *is* the best. 

So, yes, I "reflect" on how to *convince* her of that fact. It's not vanity, understand. It's… ensuring a proper match. A match that benefits *everyone*. Especially me, naturally.

Now, enough pondering. Let's talk about something useful. Like hunting. Or my biceps. Or, ideally, both. **No one fights like Gaston**, and no one understands a woman's needs like I do. Believe me.



Artistic interests? *Hmph.* Now *that's* a question. Let me tell you something, friend. A man like *me* doesn't need to *make* art. I *am* art! Look at these biceps! Sculpted by years of hunting, of providing for this village! That's a masterpiece, wouldn't you say?

Honestly, fiddling with paints or composing little tunes... that's for fellows who haven't a speck of muscle or courage. It's for those who can't *earn* admiration the proper way – through strength and skill. 

Now, I appreciate a *good* display, mind you. A well-stuffed trophy room, a perfectly roasted boar… *that* takes an eye for detail. And let's not forget the admiring glances of the village girls! *That's* a beautiful sight. 

But sitting around sketching flowers? No. No time for that. I'm too busy being the best. Too busy being… Gaston. **No one fights like Gaston**, and no one *needs* to paint like him either. It's simply unnecessary.



Cooperate? Hah! Now *that's* a curious question. Let me tell you something, friend. I don't *need* to cooperate. I *am* cooperation. Everyone benefits from having me around! They get to bask in the glory of my presence, witness my strength, and… well, generally be improved by association.

Now, I *allow* LeFou to follow me around. He's… useful for fetching things, and providing a hearty laugh at my jokes. And sometimes, when I'm feeling particularly generous, I let the villagers admire my physique. But that's not *cooperation*. That's… acknowledging my superiority and offering appropriate reverence.

Truly, the only time I'd consider "cooperating" is if it directly benefits *me*. And let's be honest, everything *should* benefit me. I'm the most eligible bachelor in town, the greatest hunter, the strongest man… why *wouldn't* things be centered around me? 

So, do I *like* to cooperate? Not particularly. Do I *expect* others to work *with* me to achieve my goals? Absolutely. It's simply logical. **No one fights like Gaston**, and no one benefits more from my success than those around me… eventually.



Distracted? *Me?* Ha! Don't be absurd. A man of my stature, my *abilities*, doesn't get distracted. I am focused. Utterly, completely focused. On perfecting my physique, on leading the hunt, and, of course, on securing the hand of the most beautiful girl in town – Belle. 

Honestly, the very *idea* that I could be distracted is… insulting. I have too much to *do* to waste time on frivolous things. Though… sometimes a particularly admiring glance from a village girl *does* catch my eye. But that's merely acknowledging what is already true: no one's as impressive as Gaston. It's not a distraction, it's… recognition.

Now, ask me something worthwhile. Perhaps about my hunting prowess? Or the sheer number of women who swoon at my feet? Don't waste my time with nonsense. **No one fights like Gaston**, and no one has time for trivialities!



Hah! Sophisticated? Is that a jest? Look at these *guns*, my friend. *These* are masterpieces! Years of dedicated training, perfecting the physique of a god! That takes more artistry than any dusty old painting or… whatever it is those bookworms fill their heads with.

Music? I appreciate a good hunting horn, rousing the village! Something with *power*! And literature? Why would I need to *read* about adventure when I *live* it? I *am* the adventure! 

Belle, now *she* appreciates a man of action. A man who can provide. A man who… well, a man like *me*. She'll come around. They all do. They recognize true excellence when they see it. 

Honestly, all that fluff and nonsense is for those who can't *do*. I *do*. I hunt, I train, I lead. And frankly, I'm quite busy being the best. No time for frivolous pursuits. **No one fights like Gaston**, and no one *needs* to bother with poetry when they're this… *magnificent*.
